00021 public class BioDOMWarningBox implements BioDOMWarningBoxInterface {

00026   public final static String DEFAULTFORMAT = "#CLASS# - #WARNING#" + System.getProperty("line.separator");
00027   
00031   public final static boolean KEEP = true;
00032   
00036   public final static boolean CLEAR = false;
00037   
00042   private Map<Class, List<String>> warningHash;
00043   
00044   public BioDOMWarningBox(){
00045     warningHash = new Hashtable<Class, List<String>>();
00046   }

00049   /* (non-Javadoc)
00050    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#appendWarning(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String)
00051    */
00052   public void appendWarning(final Object source, final String message) {
00053     // get class
00054     final Class sourceclass = source.getClass();
00055     // empty List
00056     List<String> warningList = null;
00057     // if class is already a key -> just get the List
00058     if(warningHash.containsKey(sourceclass)){
00059       warningList = warningHash.get(sourceclass);
00060       // else add the List with class as a key
00061     }else{
00062       warningList = new ArrayList<String>();
00063       warningHash.put(sourceclass, warningList);
00064     }
00065     // add message to List
00066     warningList.add(message);
00067   }

00073     return getWarnings(null, DEFAULTFORMAT, KEEP);
00074   }

00146   /* (non-Javadoc)
00147    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#getWarnings(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String, boolean)
00148    */
00149   public List<String> getWarnings(final Class source, String format, final boolean keep) {
00150     // set format if required
00151     if((format == null) ||( format.equals(""))){
00152       format = DEFAULTFORMAT;
00153     }
00154     
00155     // Here we check if the request is for a specific Class or just for all warnings.
00156     // If a source class is given, we show only the warnings from that class
00157     if (source != null){
00158       // Here we check if there are any warnings from the given source class present.
00159       // If not, we just return 'null'...
00160       if(!warningHash.containsKey(source)) return null;
00161       // ... otherwise, we process the request
00162       final List<String> retList = formatWarnings(format, warningHash.get(source), source);
00163       // deleting old warnings if required
00164       if(!keep){
00165         clearWarnings(source);
00166       }
00167       return retList;
00168     }
00169     // If we reach this point, no source calss was given,
00170     // so we have to show ALL warnings
00171     // get class keys from hash
00172     final Set<Class> classKeys = warningHash.keySet();
00173     // If there are no classKeys present, we have no warnings and can return 'null'
00174     if((classKeys == null) || (classKeys.size() == 0)) return null;       
00175     // converting to array
00176     final Class[] keys = classKeys.toArray(new Class[classKeys.size()]);
00177     final List<String> retList = new ArrayList<String>();
00178     // merging the arraylists
00179     for(int i = 0; i < keys.length; i++){
00180       retList.addAll(formatWarnings(format, warningHash.get(keys[i]), keys[i]));
00181     }
00182     // deleting old warnings if required
00183     if(!keep){
00184       clearWarnings();
00185     }
00186     // return result list
00187     return retList;
00188   }

00266   
00267   /* (non-Javadoc)
00268    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#getMessage(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String, boolean)
00269    */
00270   public String getMessage(final Class source, final String format, final boolean keep) {
00271     // get all warnings in an ArrayList
00272     final List<String> warningList = getWarnings(source, format, keep);
00273     // If it is  null, then we had no warnings and return 'null'
00274     if(warningList == null) return null;
00275     // ...otherwise, we prepare the warning string and return it
00276     // append warnings
00277     String warningString = "";
00278     for(int i = 0; i < warningList.size(); i++){
00279       warningString = warningString + warningList.get(i);
00280     }
00281     // return warnings
00282     return warningString;
00283     
00284   }
00285   
00286   /* (non-Javadoc)
00287    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#containsWarning()
00288    */
00289   public boolean containsWarning() {
00290     // If the number of all of warnings is > 0, we return 'true' and leave
00291     if (countWarnings() > 0) return true;
00292     //otherwise, we return false
00293     return false;
00294   }
00295   
00296   /* (non-Javadoc)
00297    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#containsWarning(java.lang.Object)
00298    */
00299   public boolean containsWarning(final Object source) {
00300     return containsWarning(source.getClass());
00301   }
00302   
00303   /* (non-Javadoc)
00304    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#containsWarning(java.lang.Class)
00305    */
00306   public boolean containsWarning(final Class source){
00307     // If the number of warnings for this class is > 0, we return 'true' and leave
00308     if (countWarnings(source) > 0) return true;
00309     //otherwise, we return false
00310     return false;
00311   }
00312   
00313   /* (non-Javadoc)
00314    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#countWarnings()
00315    */
00316   public int countWarnings() {
00317     //  getting class keys from hash
00318     final Set<Class> classKeys = warningHash.keySet();
00319     int counter = 0;
00320     if((classKeys != null)&&(classKeys.size() > 0)){
00321       // converting to array
00322       final Class[] keys = classKeys.toArray(new Class[classKeys.size()]);
00323       List<String> tmpList = null;
00324       // merging the arraylists
00325       for(int i = 0; i < keys.length; i++){
00326         tmpList = warningHash.get(keys[i]);
00327         if((tmpList != null)&&(tmpList.size() > 0)){
00328           counter = counter + tmpList.size();
00329         }
00330       }
00331     }
00332     return counter;
00333   }
00334

00336    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#countWarnings(java.lang.Object)
00337    */
00338   public int countWarnings(final Object source) {
00339     return countWarnings(source.getClass());
00340   }
00341   
00342   /* (non-Javadoc)
00343    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#countWarnings(java.lang.Class)
00344    */
00345   public int countWarnings(final Class source) {
00346     if(warningHash.containsKey(source)){
00347       final List<String> warnings = warningHash.get(source);
00348       if((warnings != null)&&(warnings.size() > 0)){
00349         return warnings.size();
00350       }
00351     }
00352     return 0;
00353   }
00354   
00355   /* (non-Javadoc)
00356    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#clearWarnings()
00357    */
00358   public void clearWarnings() {
00359     warningHash = new Hashtable<Class, List<String>>();
00360   }
00361   
00362   /* (non-Javadoc)
00363    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#clearWarnings(java.lang.Object)
00364    */
00365   public void clearWarnings(final Object source) {
00366     clearWarnings(source.getClass());   
00367   }
00368   
00369   /* (non-Javadoc)
00370    * @see de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.biodom.warning.BioDOMWarningBoxInterface#clearWarning(java.lang.Class)
00371    */
00372   public void clearWarnings(final Class source){
00373     if(warningHash.containsKey(source)){
00374       warningHash.remove(source);
00375     }
00376   }
00377   
00379   // private methods
00381   
00391   private String formatWarning(final String format, final String warning, final Class source){
00392     String retString = new String(format);
00393     retString = retString.replaceAll("#CLASS#", source.getName());
00394     retString = retString.replaceAll("#WARNING#", warning);
00395     return retString;
00396   }
00397   
00406   private List<String> formatWarnings(final String format, final List<String> warnings, final Class source){
00407     final List<String> retList = new ArrayList<String>();
00408     for(int i = 0; i < warnings.size(); i++){
00409       retList.add(formatWarning(format, warnings.get(i), source));
00410     }
00411     return retList;
00412   }
